alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 12:20AM PDT until May 23 at 4:46AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continue for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures this weekend will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. Minor flooding is forecast to continue for the next several days for both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.3 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM PDT Wednesday was 24.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 25.1 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.0 feet on 05/30/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 115 PM PDT.
